channel.title: Multiple site attacks via Anonymous protesting MU taken down
channel.description:
RIAA's site - tango down Universal Music Group (website) - tango down MPAA.org - tango down The US Copyright Office - tango down Major record label BMI is down for the count. French copyright authority HADOPI - tango down. WMG.com - tango down [url=http://justice.gov/]http://justice.gov/[/url] - tango down FBI.gov - tango down
They're not stopping. They're the voice of the people. They protect us, not our government.
Source(s): [url=http://gizmodo.com/5877679/anonymous-kills-department-of-justice-site-in-megaupload-r]Anonymous Goes on Megaupload Revenge Spree: DoJ, RIAA, MPAA, and Universal Music All Offline[/url] [url=http://www.techdirt.com/articles/20120119/14494917475/internet-strikes-back-anonymous-takes-down-dojgov-riaa-mpaa-sites-to-protest-megaupload-seizure.shtml?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter]The Internet Strikes Back: Anonymous Takes Down DOJ.gov, RIAA, MPAA Sites To Protest Megaupload Seizure | Techdirt www.twitter.com/youranonnews[/url]

item.title: Multiple site attacks via Anonymous protesting MU taken down
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

Taharok:

The anonymous hacktivists need to get a clue. Megaupload had reason to be shutdown, the owners were morons. This whole thing is being blown out of proportion because people are misunderstanding the reasons the owners were arrested and extradited.

Anonymous has already started #OpMegaupload. I don’t think that they’re going to stop now until it succeeds.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple site attacks via Anonymous protesting MU taken down
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:51, topic:429891”][quote author=slava link=topic=532573.msg3894519#msg3894519 date=1327190007]

The SOPA bill is a major job killer, yet the Republicans want more jobs and they want the bill to pass.

hmm.

Where the fuck did you hear this?

Which part?

The part about Republicans wanting this bill to pass. I have not heard one republican agree with this.

They’re the only supporters? They’re the ones that proposed it? They’re the ones pushing it through?

The SOPA bill is a major job killer, yet the Republicans want more jobs and they want the bill to pass.

hmm.

This has nothing to do with democrats or republicans?..

This is related to SOPA… Republicans want SOPA passed.

UPDATE: Fbi.com - tango down

please show me where republicans support this any more than democrats do?
[/quote]
Introduced by: House Judiciary Committee Chair Representative Lamar S. Smith (R-TX)
Supported by: Howard Berman (D-CA), Marsha Blackburn (R-TN), Mary Bono Mack (R-CA), Steve Chabot (R-OH), John Conyers (D-MI), Ted Deutch (D-FL), Elton Gallegly (R-CA), Bob Goodlatte (R-VA), Timothy Griffin (R-AR), Dennis A. Ross (R-FL), Adam Schiff (D-CA) and Lee Terry (R-NE).

Republicans: 8
Democrats: 4[/quote]
where did you get this info? this is what i found.

sopa initial sponsors:
Howard Berman (D-CA)
Marsha Blackburn (R-TN)
Mary Bono Mack (R-CA)
Steve Chabot (R-OH)

Timothy Griffin (R-AR)

sopa co-sonsors:

Joe Baca [D-CA43]

pipa supporters:

support

(fs - former sopa supporter
fp - former pipa supporter)

opposing sopa/pipa:

item.title: Multiple site attacks via Anonymous protesting MU taken down
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote="(N)eon, post:46, topic:429891"]InB4MITBISTHELEADEROFANONYMOUS…

OT: I like these people…[/quote]haha you never know

[quote=“killadragz14, post:48, topic:429891”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=532573.msg3892651#msg3892651 date=1327019158]
RIAA’s site - tango down
Universal Music Group (website) - tango down
MPAA.org - tango down
The US Copyright Office - tango down
Major record label BMI is down for the count.
French copyright authority HADOPI - tango down.
WMG.com - tango down
http://justice.gov/ - tango down
FBI.gov - tango down

They’re not stopping.
They’re the voice of the people.
They protect us, not our government.

Source(s):
Anonymous Goes on Megaupload Revenge Spree: DoJ, RIAA, MPAA, and Universal Music All Offline
The Internet Strikes Back: Anonymous Takes Down DOJ.gov, RIAA, MPAA Sites To Protest Megaupload Seizure | Techdirt
www.twitter.com/youranonnews
[/quote]
Lol i don’t think you guys heard of migrating servers before?
You can’t ddos those websites it would be like trying to ddos google.
soon as the website goes down is gets migrated to a new server.
You would need a shitload of bots just to slow the government websites down.

Those guys just kinda made it worst.
They may be on a vpn but it can be tracked.[/quote]I’m sure there were thousands of people attacking at once. There were probably several ip’s of theirs being attacked at once to make sure all servers ent down. I am just shocked the government doesn’t have better firewalls. A 2k$ watchguard firewall can hold up to around 6k different attacks at once easily…I would hope they even had a stronger one than that so…yeah it sort is impressive either way.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple site attacks via Anonymous protesting MU taken down
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:42, topic:429891”][quote author=ry60003333 link=topic=532573.msg3892890#msg3892890 date=1327042911]

Lol nerds that have a mass army of infected computers, they are no heroes. A real hero does his work and doesn’t spread his name, a real hero would have stated his beliefs and then left, not post from his “hacking group” that he crashed government computers by using drones he got from offering old people child porn in the form of an exe.

Anonymous didn’t crash these sites by hacking into other computers; the members voluntarily participate in the attack via LOIC.
[/quote]As much as I wish that were true, I don’t think so. There are lots of people with access to large amounts of LOIC voluteers, but it’s not enough to do this I think. They’ve shown in the past that they aren’t afraid to hack or use vulnerabilities in websites[/quote]At any rate, I hope this sends a message to the government.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple site attacks via Anonymous protesting MU taken down
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

All of the republican presidential candidates are fucking retarded and crazy. Obama is easily going to win the 2012 election.

[quote=“badger41, post:23, topic:429891”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=532573.msg3892734#msg3892734 date=1327027855]

I’m watching the presidential debate right now.
Seems as if Newt Gingrich is the only viable canidate, but who cares. Obama is going to win #Obama2012
[/quote]

Name one good thing that has come out of Obama’s administration, also keep in mind the stuff he ‘promised’ in his 2008 campaign but has yet to show any movement towards it[/quote] Every single president ever elected makes retarded promises that are never filled.

The one thing that every person who argues and opposes Obama says one thing, that thing is “He put us more in debt than any other president before.” When Bush put us in two wars, he actually had the money that funded the war coming off of loans from the International Bank. Obama came into office and actually noticed that we need to cut the loans and start funding the wars that Bush started off tax-payer money. Obama switched it over and now our Nation Debt is even higher because the money is coming from the proper place and not money from other countries. I don’t believe I have ever had a conversation regarding the bad things Obama has done that didn’t include this. This is the only thing ever brought up and people who bring this up are so indenial about how well Obama has done in the last 4 years. Of course, he isn’t the best president we have ever had and he sure dosen’t beat Clinton, but he easily beats Bush and all the 2012 republican presidential candidates.

Read full topic

[quote=“ox random xi, post:19, topic:429891”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=532573.msg3892680#msg3892680 date=1327021629]

hmm.

hmm.

This has nothing to do with democrats or republicans?..

This is related to SOPA… Republicans want SOPA passed.

UPDATE: Fbi.com - tango down[/quote]

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_legislators_who_support_or_oppose_SOPA/PIPA read. more democrats support SOPA than republicans. SOPA may have been introduced by a republican but PIPA was introduced by a democrat. also extra info for anyone that didn’t know; the KKK was founded by democrats; martin luther king jr. was a republican; also thoughout history democrats have opposed blacks. you can take what you read from here (http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20080424031312AAj699n) with a grain of salt but a person looking for the truth would do research to see if such claims are true.
